duck: Relaxation (iterative method) - In numerical mathematics, relaxation methods are iterative methods for solving systems of equations, including nonlinear systems.
Smoothing (phonetics) - Smoothing is a phonetic process whereby adjacent vowel sounds are merged into a single sound.
Curve fitting - Curve fitting is the process of constructing a curve, or mathematical function, that has the best fit to a series of data points, possibly subject to constraints.
Having a surface free from irregularities, roughness, or projections; even.

Convolution - In mathematics and, in particular, functional analysis, convolution is a mathematical operation on two functions f and g, producing a third function that is typically viewed as a modifie...

In statistics and image processing, to smooth a data set is to create an approximating function that attempts to capture important patterns in the data, while leaving out noise or other fine-scale structures/rapid phenomena.
Edge preserving smoothing - Edge-preserving smoothing is an image processing technique that smooths away textures whilst retaining sharp edges.
